product_name: AquaphorLip Repair Lip Balm with SPF 30
summary: SummaryFind long-lasting moisture and protect lips from the sun with Aquaphor Lip Repair Lip Balm with SPF 30, from the #1 dermatologist recommended lip care brand.
details: DetailsBenefitsClinically proven to relieve dryness and soothe chapped, cracked lipsLip balm tube slips conveniently into your pocket or bag for on-the-go useKey IngredientsFormulated with nourishing vitamins and Shea ButterIncludes Broad Spectrum SPF 30 sunscreenFormulated WithoutFragrance free and paraben free lip balm for chapped lipsItem 2636727How To UseApply Aquaphor Lip Balm with SPF 30 liberally to chapped, dry lips as often as needed and for sunscreen, use as directed. The lip balm glides on easily and is great for use in dry, cold or windy conditions and to help prevent sunburn.For sunscreen use: Apply liberally 15 minutes before sun exposure. Use a water resistant sunscreen if swimming or sweating. Reapply at least every 2 hours. Children under 6 months of age: Ask a doctor.Precautions: For external use only. Do not use on damaged or broken skin. When using this product keep out of eyes. Rinse with water to remove. Stop use and ask a doctor if irritation occurs. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.IngredientsActive: Petrolatum 31.0%...Purpose: Skin Protectant, Avobenzone 3.0%...Purpose: Sunscreen, Octinoxate 6.75%...Purpose: Sunscreen, Octisalate 4.5%...Purpose: Sunscreen, Octocrylene 2.0%...Purpose: Sunscreen, Oxybenzone 5.4%...Purpose: Sunscreen. Inactive: C18-38 Alkyl Hydroxystearoyl Stearate, Octyldodecanol, Glycerin, Ricinus Communis (Castor) Seed Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Panthenol, Water, Polyglyceryl-3 Diisostearate, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Tocopheryl Acetate, Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Beeswax, C20-40 Alkyl Stearate, Magnesium Sulfate, Magnesium Stearate, BHT.
how_to_use: Apply Aquaphor Lip Balm with SPF 30 liberally to chapped, dry lips as often as needed and for sunscreen, use as directed. The lip balm glides on easily and is great for use in dry, cold or windy conditions and to help prevent sunburn.For sunscreen use: Apply liberally 15 minutes before sun exposure. Use a water resistant sunscreen if swimming or sweating. Reapply at least every 2 hours. Children under 6 months of age: Ask a doctor.Precautions: For external use only. Do not use on damaged or broken skin. When using this product keep out of eyes. Rinse with water to remove. Stop use and ask a doctor if irritation occurs. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.
ingredients: Oxybenzone 5.4%...Purpose: Sunscreen. Inactive: C18-38 Alkyl Hydroxystearoyl Stearate

reviews.headline: Overnight miracle
reviews.comments: My lips get super dry because of my Invisalign and my lip stain that i wear every day. I put this on at night and by the morning they are so much better!

reviews.headline: Not the bestâ€¦
reviews.comments: Made my lips burn so bad!!

reviews.headline: Best for Dry Lips!
reviews.comments: I have been using this for a few months now. I have dry lips due to dry mouth issues and need something that lasts long and heals quickly. this is my go-to! it's so moisturizing and healing, plus lasts a long time and is a really reasonable price!

reviews.headline: Separates bad
reviews.comments: I used this for awhile and its biggest issue is how bad it separates, its like the sunscreen and aquaphor do not wanna mix, I would try and remix it in the tube but it didn't really work, I would go to use it and just watery sunscreen would come out. Stay with the stick version if you want SPF

reviews.headline: Tingles (not in a good way) and tastes awful
reviews.comments: I honestly thought I was having an allergic reaction to this product, but I guess I'm not the only one who experienced tingling. It wasn't tingling you might expect with a lip plumping product. And it tastes absolutely horrid and medicinal. I wish I could take it back.

reviews.headline: Tingles (not in a good way) and tastes awful
reviews.comments: I honestly thought I was having an allergic reaction to this product, but I guess I'm not the only one who experienced tingling. It wasn't tingling you might expect with a lip plumping product. And it tastes absolutely horrid and medicinal. I wish I could take it back.

reviews.headline: doesn't compare to the original
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this since the original formula is so moisturizing, but it falls short. the burning sensation lingers & I had no choice but to wipe it off shortly after each application. unfortunately, I had to throw this out. I got a tube for someone else & they also said it irritates their lips.

reviews.headline: My HG daily lip balm
reviews.comments: Nothing leaves my lips softer than this. And it had SPF to top it off ðŸ’•

reviews.headline: It burns
reviews.comments: Really wanted to like this product & got it bc I was going on a tropical vacation but omg does it burn!! And on too of that it made my lips feel dry afterwards - definitely not worth it. Try another SPF lip balm or just stick to the original

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments: I love the Aquaphor brand for the ointment for burns and dryness but this lip gloss with sunscreen made my lips peal. I have sensitive skin. It must be the sunscreen ingredient that made my lips peal. I'm returning this product. I ended up just getting regular chapstick from Loccitane for my dry lips. I would like sunscreen protection for my lips. I'll keep looking.

reviews.headline: If you enjoy tasting sunscreen all day...
reviews.comments: I absolutely hated this because all I was tasting all day was sunscreen.

reviews.headline: New everyday staple!
reviews.comments: This feels moisturizing and I love how it has SPF! Its a thinner/lighter consistency than typical aquaphor, but it feels pretty hydrating and it has helped my chapped lips. It does smell like typical sunscreen, but it doesn't really have a taste. I wish they made bigger sizes of this because I will be using this everyday!

faceoff_positive.comments: This feels moisturizing and I love how it has SPF! Its a thinner/lighter consistency than typical aquaphor, but it feels pretty hydrating and it has helped my chapped lips. It does smell like typical sunscreen, but it doesn't really have a taste. I wish they made bigger sizes of this because I will be using this everyday!
faceoff_positive.headline: New everyday staple!

faceoff_negative.comments: I love the Aquaphor brand for the ointment for burns and dryness but this lip gloss with sunscreen made my lips peal. I have sensitive skin. It must be the sunscreen ingredient that made my lips peal. I'm returning this product. I ended up just getting regular chapstick from Loccitane for my dry lips. I would like sunscreen protection for my lips. I'll keep looking.
